alert.note: Alert for Liberty; Polk; San Jacinto (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 24 at 9:59AM CST until further notice by NWS Houston - Galveston
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Houston/Galveston TX has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Texas... Trinity River near Goodrich affecting Polk, Liberty and San Jacinto Counties. For the Trinity River...including Crockett, Riverside, Romayor, Goodrich, Liberty, Moss Bluff...Major flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS AFTERNOON UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Trinity River near Goodrich. * WHEN...From this afternoon until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 38.0 feet, Moderate lowland flooding begins. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:45 AM CST Wednesday the stage was 30.3 feet. - Bankfull stage is 36.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late this afternoon and continue rising to a crest of 38.7 feet tomorrow morning. - Flood stage is 36.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 38.6 feet on 01/16/1991. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (12 pm CST) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Thu Fri Sat Trinity River Goodrich 36.0 30.3 Wed 9 am CST 38.4 37.1 36.5 &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued late tonight at 400 AM CST.
